definition: from now on/in the future/time to come
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: And look a little further down in the same paragraph.
It won't hurt to postpone the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 不妨把開會時間往後延。

sentences.english: Fortunately, Ijurmped back in time to avoid being hit.
sentences.chinese: 很僥倖，我及時往後跳以免費遭撞擊。

sentences.english: This is a warmup for a later level.
sentences.chinese: 這一關是爲往後的關卡暖身。

sentences.english: Something's come up. Can we make our appointment a little later?
sentences.chinese: 出了一些狀況。我們的約會可以往後延些時間嗎？

sentences.english: That's a seriously long time from now.
sentences.chinese: 那是從今往後極長的一段時間。

sentences.english: He stood back and just watched as she birthed her baby without fuss or noise.
sentences.chinese: 他往後站，只是看着她生孩子，沒有慌亂或吵鬧。

sentences.english: She recoiled at the sight of the snake.
Procedures and processes, in the next track slowly chewing.
sentences.chinese: 程序與過程，在往後的行跡中慢慢咀嚼。

sentences.english: Time to move forward, I also look forward to what?
sentences.chinese: 時間向前走，我還往後看做什麼？

sentences.english: For the future, try to be more careful.
Carefully pull back the access line. The kink should be in the bottom of the burr hole.
sentences.chinese: 小心的往後拉入顱線，扭結應處於單孔的底端。

sentences.english: Buckwheat leaned backwards much more arrogantly than before.
sentences.chinese: 蕎麥往後挺了挺身子，比以前更加傲慢了。

sentences.english: And henceforth I will go celebrate any thing I see or am.
sentences.chinese: 從今往後我縫人便贊管他對我如何看。

sentences.english: From this day forward, may a new song be heard.
sentences.chinese: 從今往後，或許可以聽到一首新歌。

sentences.english: The librarian threw back his head and laughed shrilly.
sentences.chinese: 圖書管理員把頭往後面一仰，尖着嗓子哈哈大笑。

definition: to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
to catch and hold on/to continue/to go on to do sth/to follow/to carry on/then/after that/subsequently/to proceed/to ensue/in turn/in one's turn
the rear/far behind the front line
behind/at the back/in the rear/behind sb's back
